harmony.physicalContactObject: single wooden chopstick or bamboo stick
harmony.physicalSubstrateObject: small stack of neon green sticky notes
harmony.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the chopstick near its midpoint with a standard pencil grip and execute fine, rapid painting gestures
harmony.substrateUtilizationMethod: Place the stack flat on the table so the top sheet lies horizontally. Glide the chopstick tip lightly across the upper sheet while performing stroke motions.
harmony.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
harmony.explanation: The sticky-note pad gives a light, slightly soft contact that is felt whenever the chopstick touches, so timing is acceptable. However the pad is only ~5×5 cm and horizontal, while the virtual canvas is 20×26 cm and often vertical, so many visual strokes will miss the small proxy, reducing consistency.

harmony.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
harmony.explanation: The poster roll is long enough to give continuous contact during strokes, ensuring touch whenever the brush appears to hit the canvas. The curved surface and horizontal orientation diverge from a flat vertical canvas but still allow reliable contact, so synchronization is fairly good though not perfect.

realism.expectedHapticFeedback: use the hammer to smash slime. user would experience a sudden dampened impact through the handle
realism.explanation: Glass and hard plastic result in a crisp, undamped knock— completely unlike the soft, viscous resistance of slime.

realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip one end of the tube with a full hand and swing the far end downward in a short arc to make contact with the target surface
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand beside the bench and tap the cushion’s surface straight down with the tube.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: use the hammer to smash slime. user would experience a sudden dampened impact through the handle
realism.explanation: The foam cushion compresses and absorbs energy, giving a noticeable damped stop similar to soft slime. The lightweight tube still limits the perceived momentum, but the substrate’s yielding nature makes this one of the closer matches.
